articles.title: Boa v0.20: An Alternative JavaScript Compiler
articles.description: Under development for several years, Boa has a few missions: be a Rust ECMAScript implementation, be easy to embed in Rust projects, and be a fast, safe JS engine overall. v0.20 sees a bump up to 89.92% compliance in the Test262 suite, improves Temporal support, adds Atomics.pause, and more. This is no toy engine.
articles.author: Boa Developers

articles.title: React v19 Now Stable
articles.description: First teased in a February 2024 update, React 19 has been in beta for 8 months, so there‚Äôs already a wealth of content about it, from the React 19 upgrade guide or an explanation of its compiler to cheat sheets and Vercel‚Äôs roundup of what‚Äôs new in React 19.
articles.author: The React Team

articles.title: The State of Node.js Performance in 2024
articles.description: A thorough set of benchmarks covering recent performance advancements made in Node.js. The improvements between Node 18 and 20 up to version 22 might surprise you - it‚Äôs clear the team has put a lot of work into this area.
articles.author: Gonzaga and Parody (NodeSource)

articles.title: Publishing a Simple Client-Side JS Package to npm with GitHub¬†Actions
articles.description: As part of the process of building Prompts.js, a new library for creating simple await-able alternatives to alert(), confirm() and prompt(), Simon wanted to make it easy to publish as an npm package too.
articles.author: Simon Willison

articles.title: How to Build a SolidJS App with Deno
articles.description: SolidJS is a declarative library for creating user interfaces that emphasizes fine-grained reactivity and minimal overhead and it plays well with Deno.
articles.author: Andy Jiang

articles.title: Termo: An Easy to Use Terminal Control for Websites
articles.description: If you want to offer a terminal emulator style feature on your site (maybe for advanced users, to enhance your docs, or even just as an easter egg), Termo enhances Xterm.js and presents a slick experience.
articles.author: Raj Nandan Sharma

articles.title: üñºÔ∏è¬†wasm-vips: libvips Image Processing via WebAssembly
articles.description: libvips is an efficient image processing library written in C. This build offers an isomorphic route to using it in the browser, as well as Node and Deno, all thanks to WebAssembly. (There's an interactive demo here.)
articles.author: Kleis Auke Wolthuizen

articles.title: Civet 0.9: Code More with Less Using a TypeScript Superset
articles.description: Two years old and well maintained, Civet offers an interesting approach. Think JavaScript but with Python style indentation, chained comparisons, built-in JSX, & more. This example alone shows off the potential for tighter, easier-to-write code.
articles.author: Daniel X Moore and Contributors

articles.title: Rockpack 5.0: An Alternative React App Starter
articles.description: A Create React App-style tool aiming to get React project setup time as low as possible, complete with server side rendering support, bundling, linting and testing. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Alex Sergey

articles.title: jsesc: Get a Stringified, ASCII-Safe Representation of Any Data
articles.description: Think JSON.stringify() but instead it returns JavaScript meaning it can support things like maps, sets, and BigInts.
articles.author: Mathias Bynens

articles.description: üéÆ If you ever do any game development with JavaScript, it's time to take the Gamedev.JS Survey 2024. If you don't, you can head to JS13KGames and enjoy other people's creative efforts instead :-)
Apple has released Safari 18.2 which introduces a few enhancements to JavaScript support including Float16Array, more methods for Uint8Array, Promise.try, RegExp.escape, and more.
Did you know Douglas Crockford is Not Your Dad? Well, at least when it comes to putting comments in JSON..
VS Code November Release ‚Äì Now when you copy and paste JS/TS code, VS Code can add imports for the pasted code.
Next.js 15.1 ‚Äì The popular React framework gets full React 19 support.
Node v23.4.0 (Current) ‚Äì Say hello to assert.partialDeepStrictEqual and --trace-env for tracing environment variable usage.
Sheriff v25 - Opinionated TypeScript-first ESLint configuration. Now supporting ESLint v9.
Undici 7.1 ‚Äì HTTP/2 support now marked as stable in the Node.js HTTP library.
pnpm 9.15, Dependency Cruiser 16.8, Redux Toolkit 2.5, YouTube.js 12.2

articles.title: üóìÔ∏è¬†The 2024 Web Almanac
articles.description: This comprehensive report on the state of the web returns to wrap up 2024. This edition has 21 chapters (most of which are available now) covering UX, accessibility, publishing, content distribution, and more. All of the metrics shared are based on real world data from over 16 million websites.
articles.author: HTTP Archive

articles.title: Creating a Pure CSS Halftone Effect in 3 Declarations
articles.description: Creating a halftone effect in pure CSS using just a single div, no pseudos and just three properties. Talk about efficient (and visually striking, too).
articles.author: Ana Tudor

articles.title: CSS Wrapped 2024
articles.description: A fun (pixel-art filled) exploration of the new additions to the web platform in 2024, including cross-document view-transitions, scroll-driven animations, anchor positioning, and more.
articles.author: Chrome DevRel Team

articles.title: Solved By Modern CSS: Feature Image
articles.description: Ahmad shares how container queries and CSS :has() can help build a neat featured image component that changes depending on viewport/container size. As ever, great illustrations and code examples to help our understanding.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Custom Dropdowns Just Got a Whole Lot Easier (Finally!)
articles.description: A quick look at the upcoming customizable select element that makes it easy to create totally custom dropdown selects with just HTML and CSS, no JS needed. It‚Äôs currently available behind an experimental flag in Chromium browsers, but wider support is expected in 2025.
articles.author: Wes Bos

articles.title: 'My Issues with Shorthand Properties'
articles.description: A bold claim here, stating that the ‚Äúremoval of CSS shorthand properties would benefit us all‚Äù. H√•vard adds that writing explicit properties over shorthand is the way to go: ‚ÄúClarity trumps cleverness‚Äù.
articles.author: H√•vard Brynjulfsen

articles.title: What Do the State of CSS and HTML Surveys Tell Us?
articles.description: Rachel (of the Chrome Web Dev relations team) takes an initial look at some of the most interesting findings from these surveys, highlighting the top browser support issues, missing features, and more.
articles.author: Rachel Andrew

articles.title: Using Transformers.js for AI in the Browser
articles.description: Transformers.js is a seriously impressive project we link from time to time that lets you run pretrained machine learning models in the browser. Here‚Äôs a practical look at actually playing with it yourself right now.
articles.author: Raymond Camden

articles.title: Mastering SVG Arcs
articles.description: Akshay shares his love of drawing in code, in turn demystifying how to use radii, rotation and arc direction to make intricate SVG designs.
articles.author: Akshay Gupta

articles.title: Multi-State Buttons
articles.description: Typically, buttons are either pressed or they aren‚Äôt. But as long as you handle it in an accessible way, you can make a group of radio inputs look like a multi-state button with some neat CSS trickery. Preethi shows us how.
articles.author: Preethi Sam

articles.title: Gradienty: A Suite of CSS Tools & Generators
articles.description: Currently includes 11 different tools including generators for Tailwind gradients, CSS animations, mesh gradients, text gradients, box shadows, and more.
articles.author: Gradienty

articles.title: Roquefort - WebGPU Fluid Simulator
articles.description: A browser-based 3D simulator that uses WebGPU compute shaders. You can edit the scene, speed, along with various effects.
articles.author: Jerry Ylilammi

articles.title: InclusiveColors: A Color Palette Creator for WCAG-Compliant¬†Colors
articles.description: Offers features like precise control of every shade/tint that‚Äôs generated, live contrast checking as you edit, and ability to export to CSS, Tailwind, Adobe products, and more.
articles.author: Sean Wilson

articles.title: Codate: Easily Create Custom Date Formats in Any Programming Language
articles.description: A neat little resource to get a code snippet for common date formats ‚Äì hyphenated, slashed, dotted, standard with commas, etc. Supports 11 languages including JS, Go, Python, Java, PHP, and more.
articles.author: Badreddine Ibril

articles.title: PicLooks: Authentic Looking AI-Generated Profile Photos
articles.description: An alternative to using stock photos, these do have a more realistic look than some other AI-generated photos, and they‚Äôre free to use commercially without attribution.
articles.author: PicLooks
